ARTICLE.TITLE: Marshfield police arrest three teens after Tuesday's threats at high school
ARTICLE.TEXT:
MARSHFIELD - Police arrested three Marshfield students Wednesday on suspicion of making terroristic threats.

Officers took an 18-year-old man and two 17-year-old boys to the Wood County Jail and have requested charges from the Wood County District Attorney's Office, according to police.

A "specific threat" was found on a bathroom stall at Marshfield High School Tuesday and students there were released at 11:30 a.m. as a precaution, according to Marshfield police.

RELATED: Classes to resume Wednesday at Marshfield High School after early dismissal due to threat

RELATED: Man with gloves in his pocket mistaken for suspicious person with a gun at UWSP Marshfield

The Marshfield School District released a statement Tuesday that the threatening messages were made to disrupt classes and cause school closures.

In Wisconsin, 17-year-old defendants are treated as adults in the court system.

Classes resumed at Marshfield High School on Wednesday as normally scheduled.
